Je suis chanteur - auteur - compositeur - parolier – interprète /

Je suis disponible en tant que chanteur/
je suis ouvert à tout les propositions à tout les styles de musique, mélanger l’Afrique avec le monde entier/
je suis professionnelle depuis 40 ans/
j’aime le piano/
j’aimerais chanter en duo/
je ne sais pas lire nie écrire les notes, je écoute la musique pour ajouter les paroles et la mélodie/
j'ai des années d’expérience dans des orchestre d’interprétation/
site Web- http://www.toussaint-lyondholi.com/
linkedin - http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=325060754&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile
google+ - https://plus.google.com/u/1/+ToussaintLyondholi/posts
facebook - https://www.facebook.com/lyondholitoussaint

I am a singer - author - composer - lyricist - interpreter / I am available as a singer / I am open to any proposals to all styles of music, mix Africa with the world / I am working since 40 years / I love the piano / I would like to sing a duet / I can not read deny write notes, I listen to music to add lyrics and melody / I have years of experience in orchestral interpretation / site Web- http://www.toussaint-lyondholi.com/
linkedin - http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=325060754&trk=nav_responsive_tab_profile
google+ - https://plus.google.com/u/1/+ToussaintLyondholi/posts
facebook - https://www.facebook.com/lyondholitoussaint

Hi, I'm David McNair from The Rocking Sock Puppet. I'm a pretty versatile drummer and I'm in music for the creative outlet it provides me. I'm on this site to interact with other musicians and provide an alternative to canned MIDI drums for anyone that would like it on their track. You can check out some examples of my work at www.facebook.com/TheRockingSockPuppet if you are interested. I've never charged for a drum session, and my band works solely to raise money for charity and makes music for the fun of it, so don't think I'm trying to sell session drumming. Honestly, I just do it for the fun of it and probably always will. I work in Logic Pro X.
Fred Jfjamstudios@gmail.comdavidmcnair1https://sites.google.com/feeds/content/site/fjatestsite/16545187836238877442014-03-12T13:33:04.326Z2014-03-12T13:33:52.550Z2014-03-12T13:33:51.282ZPiyali Ganguly

Hi Friends.
I am not sure what exactly to write about myself. I am a simple outspoken person, a mother, wife and singer/songwriter. I am not bound by any particular genre, but rather go by what suits me, how I am feeling about any song that is requested of me to sing. I do not like to say "Yes" blindly, making false promises, if I feel I will not be able to do true justice to a song. For me, this will not be respecting the lyricist, the music composer, etc. If a song speaks to me (lyrics and music together) and I find myself being able to sing it naturally without much effort, I feel I can truly say "Yes" from my heart.

I write my own songs whenever it flows out of me.

I also enjoy unique sounds/songs which are ethereal, hauntingly beautiful and does not fall in any particular genre.

I enjoy good, wonderful collaborations, that are based on genuine love for music and harmony between the collaborators.

Please find visit my websites to listen to some of what I sing:

https://soundcloud.com/piyali-ganguly-1

https://www.youtube.com/user/Piyali521

http://fandalism.com/piyali

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Piyali-Ganguly/515416588483681?ref=hl

I hope to be able to collaborate with some of you.

Thank you for having me here. I wish you all a beautiful successful now and forever!

Piyali

I've sung in a number of original bands & a cover band from Newcastle near Sydney. I also supplemented my muso/dole income in those days by singing voice-overs for adverts.

I am new to song-writing & production, but have a sound understanding & read music thanks to years of singing lessons & choirs. I have a good ear for pitch & am proficient at harmonies.

You can find my original and covers at:-


http://www.soundclick.com/bands/default.cfm?bandID=716174

http://www.reverbnation.com/susanraines

http://www2.mixposure.com/Susan_Raines/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Susan-Raines-SingerSongwriter/160170677355777


Please take the time to go to one of my music pages to listen to a few of my songs to ensure that I have the voice you are after. I am capable with most genres and can adapt my voice to suit the feeling of the song. I personally do not like competing for vocals on a song, so as I said please make sure I have the voice you want.

If you are only wanting to use my voice and not my songwriting skills, please ensure that your song is actually ready for recording. Whilst I realise most songs need a little tweak here and there, please ensure that the song lyrics work with the music in meter and rhythm.

I look forward to meeting you all and making wonderful music with you.
All the best...
Susan

Roma Ransom formed 3 years ago when two lovebirds, Gordon and Grace, started busking in downtown Springfield Missouri. The couple quickly took their music on the road, performing as far as the West Coast, up to Northern Minnesota, all the way down to New Mexico, and everywhere in-between. On their journey they landed steady gigs and stayed busy by performing for private parties and events in their off time. Now Roma Ransom is based out of Colorado Springs where they teach private music lessons, play gigs at local venues, and perform for private events! With constant positive feed-back, Gordon and Grace, continue to do what they love. Roma Ransom’s influences range from Django Reindhardt to Woody Guthrie. Roma Ransom loves to play music inspired from ancient tunes selected from different cultures of the world. Roma Ransom performs music of the world. The best way to understand their unique style is to listen to a track. Places you may have seen Roma Ransom include, but are not limited to; Gem of India, Little Nepal, The Triple Nickel, Lofty’s, The Coffee Exchange, Urban Steam, the Tri-Lakes Center for the Arts, ViewPointe Assisted Living Center, Meadow Muffins, Poor Richard’s/Rico’s, The Antler’s Hilton, as well as non-profit events such as the Relay for Life.

http://gordiedean.wix.com/roma-ransom

I was a radio deejay at 13 radio stations in N.C. in a career that lasted from my teens to about 40 years old. 70s, 80s, early 90s. Back in the analog days. I was the guy that decided whose records got played. I have a broad based understanding of how the music industry works from my broadcast experience. I give free advice. I started playing in church and then at hundreds of Honky Tonks down south. I can't escape who I am and my sound reflects that. I want to sound bluesy and sometimes jazzy, but I always end up sounding country. Check out my sound at willieboywilliamson.com or on youtube. My main skill is lyrics. From broadcasting I have a large vocabulary. Writing lyrics is easy for me. Songs in minutes if I want. Anytime Anywhere, I can write a song about anything.

http://youtube.com/willieboywilliamson

I’m a lyricist from Australia. I’ve been writing as a hobby for myself, and want to take it to a high level where people can hear it. My goal is to write lyrics that people can relate to and say ‘that is exactly how I feel but didn’t know how to say’ and make them feel emotions. I’m in the process of re-checking some lyrics so please bear with me till I post some up. Any Questions, please feel free to ask, and I welcome all feedback.

My email address is HERE

After trying several local blues, cover and original bands to varying degrees of obscurity, Guy migrated back to his acoustic roots in the early 90’s and began to gather a sporadic fair weather following as a solo performer, rendering a quirky mix of blues and classic rock covers as well as his own material. This is how it is done to current times. Now more obscure than ever, Guy can be captured live across New England at various pubs, events, restaurants, bike rallies, pig roasts and drink-em-ups.
Guy's three self released CD’s on Walking Bear Records are available through CD Baby, Amazon and other fine online retailers. Guys recorded work has been featured in the TV shows “Trailer Fabulous” and MTV’s “Made”.
http://www.reverbnation.com/friskyweemonkey

I'm from The Netherlands. My body is 57. Played in bands during 70's/80's late & 90's. Been home recording since 76. Started with A Philips 2 track open real with muli-play feature. yeah...them goold old days. Since late 2005 I'm part of the cyber music vibe. mainly at Soundclick Seniors. Ooh yeah...side step at Mixposure. Even had a Radio Show there :-)
